info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:17PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Broadwater and southwestern Meagher Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 416 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Townsend, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Broadwater and southwestern Meagher Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
